intro: Androsaemum foetidum, commonly known as the stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often pungent foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and have a strong, unpleasant odor. Androsaemum foetidum is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain environments.
